nodes.name: Search_for_Old_Cases_and_Tasks
nodes.description: Limit set to 500 cases per batch to avoid performance issues
nodes.title: Search for Old Cases and Tasks

nodes.name: raise_case_search_failures
nodes.description: If the case search was unsuccessful or contained errors, force a batch failure
nodes.title: raise case search failures

nodes.name: set_filter_conditions
nodes.description: Set the maximum case age and (optionally) any additional search filter to apply
nodes.title: set filter conditions

nodes.name: skip_if_minimum_age_invalid
nodes.description: If the max case age is set to a negative number or any other invalid value, skip remaining steps to avoid accidentally deleting cases which should not be deleted
nodes.title: skip if minimum age invalid

nodes.name: calculate_minimum_case_date
nodes.lql:
`SELECT STRING(DATE_ADD(current_date(), 0 - max_case_age_days)) AS min_case_date, 
       optional_case_filter
FROM skip_if_minimum_age_invalid`
nodes.description: If the max case age is set to a negative number, end here and skip remaining steps to avoid accidentally deleting cases which should not be deleted.
nodes.title: calculate minimum case date

nodes.name: prep_case_search
nodes.lql:
`SELECT 
PRINTF('issuetype = case and created < "%s"%s',
  min_case_date,
  CASE
    WHEN optional_case_filter REGEXP '\\S' THEN PRINTF(' and (%s)', TRIM(optional_case_filter))
    ELSE ''
  END
) AS case_filter,

*

FROM calculate_minimum_case_date`

nodes.name: parse_and_validate_case_search_results
nodes.lql:
`SELECT 

  REGEXP_REPLACE(

    CASE
      WHEN exit_code = 241
        THEN 'Case search failed: timed out before completing'

      WHEN exit_code = 0 AND GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.has_error") = false AND GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.id") != ''
        THEN ''

      WHEN result = '' AND stderr LIKE 'Traceback%'
        THEN COALESCEEMPTY(REGEXP_EXTRACT(stderr, '([^\\n]+)\\n\\[.* was killed because of Timeout'), stderr)

      WHEN COALESCEEMPTY(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.error"), stderr) != ''
        THEN PRINTF('Case search failed: %s', COALESCEEMPTY(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.error"), stderr))

      ELSE 'Error during case search: no error provided, but unexpected result: ' || result
    END,

    '^(?=.)',
    'Case search failed: '
  ) AS integ_error,

  GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.id") AS issue_id,

  FROM_UNIXTIME(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.createdAt") / 1000, 'yyyy-MM-dd') AS issue_create_date,

  INT(REGEXP_EXTRACT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.id"), '(\\d+)')) AS issue_id_num,

  GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.issueType") AS issue_type,
  GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.title") AS issue_title,
  GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.caseType") AS case_type,

*
FROM Search_for_Old_Cases_and_Tasks
WHERE NOT IFNULL(result, '') REGEXP "no results returned"
ORDER BY integ_error DESC, issue_create_date ASC, issue_id_num ASC`
nodes.description: Verify that the Search Cases integration completed successfully. If the search was successful but no results were returned, end here and skip remaining steps.
nodes.title: parse and validate case search results

nodes.name: parse_case_deletion_results
nodes.lql:
`SELECT REGEXP_REPLACE(CASE
  WHEN exit_code = 241 THEN 'timed out before completing'
  WHEN exit_code = 0 AND GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.has_error") = false AND GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.message") != '' THEN ''
  WHEN GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.error") REGEXP "Case with id .*? doesn't exist" THEN REGEXP_EXTRACT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.error"), "(Case with id .*? doesn't exist)")
  WHEN result = '' AND stderr LIKE 'Traceback%'
    THEN COALESCEEMPTY(REGEXP_EXTRACT(stderr, '([^\\n]+)\\n\\[.* was killed because of Timeout'), stderr)
  WHEN COALESCEEMPTY(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.error"), stderr) != '' THEN PRINTF('%s', COALESCEEMPTY(GET_JSON_OBJECT(result, "$.error"), stderr))
  ELSE 'no error provided, but unexpected result: ' || result
END, '^(?=.)', 'Case deletion failed: ') AS integ_error,
*
FROM Delete_Old_Cases_and_Tasks`

nodes.name: final_output
nodes.lql:
`SELECT 'Deleted successfully' AS output,
       issue_id, case_type, issue_create_date, issue_title
FROM fail_if_case_deletion_failed`

nodes.name: minimum_case_age_invalid
nodes.lql:
`SELECT PRINTF('Invalid max case age (%s). Set max_case_age_days to a positive number.', max_case_age_days) AS output
FROM set_filter_conditions
WHERE INT(max_case_age_days) <= 0 OR INT(max_case_age_days) IS NULL`

descriptor.name: Case Management
descriptor.description: An Integration to manage LogicHub Cases. It can create new cases, get all cases, get a specific case's details and update or delete a case.

steps.name: Case Management Authentication Information
steps.description: Enter authentication information for Case Management integration

inputs.description: Label for this integration instance.
inputs.label: Label

inputs.description: Define variables here to templatize integration connections and actions. For example, you can use https://www.{{hostname}}.com, where hostname is a variable defined in this input.
inputs.label: Reference Values

inputs.description: Select option to verify connecting server's SSL certificate (Default is Verify SSL Certificate)
inputs.label: Verify SSL

inputs.description: URL of your Logichub instance. Eg: https://xyz.logichub.com (Default to connect to the local LogicHub server using https://nginx:8443)
inputs.label: URL

inputs.description: API Token for accessing Case Management
inputs.label: API Token

actions.description: Search issues. Uses older APIs, no longer under maintenance.

inputs.description: Jinja2 template for search text. Leave empty to get all cases. For advanced query see help: https://help.logichub.com/docs/advanced-case-search
inputs.label: Filter Query

inputs.description: Explode each result in a separate row. (default: No)
inputs.label: Explode Results

inputs.description: Limit number of search results to (Default is 10,000 cases)
inputs.label: Limit Search Results

inputs.description: Time to wait between consecutive API requests in milliseconds (Default is 0 millisecond)
inputs.label: Time between consecutive API requests (in millis)

inputs.description: Timeout in seconds (Default is 360 seconds)
inputs.label: Action Timeout

inputs.description: Number of rows to read from parent table
inputs.label: Rows to Process

inputs.description: Count of threads to use for processing rows of input table (Default is 1 thread)
inputs.label: Count of threads

failedAttempt.errorMessage: This imported connection is using a different version of the Case Management (logichub.case_management) integration than what is currently available on this deployment. Please edit the connection to ensure it works correctly.
